article.headline: Creighton 82, Drake 69
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Johnny Mathies scored 22 of his career-high 32 points in the first half and Creighton built a 28-point lead en route to an 82-69 victory over Drake on Sunday. Nick Porter added 12 points for the Bluejays (9-4, 3-2 Missouri Valley Conference), who shot 58 percent from the field. Creighton extended its home winning streak to 12 games, including eight in a row this season, and the Bluejays have won 16 of its last 20 meetings with Drake. Drake (9-7, 2-3), which shot 42 percent, was led by Al Stewart's 14 points and Ajay Calvin's 13 points and seven rebounds. Mathies was 11-for-17, including 6-of-10 on 3-pointers. He also had five rebounds and four steals. Creighton used a 14-2 spurt to start the second half to lead 62-34 with 15:29 to play. But the Bulldogs used a 16-0 run to get within 12 before Mathies scored on a fast-break layup and Porter converted a three-point play to make it 67-52 with 10:18 left. Drake closed to 70-62 with 6:35 left, but the Bluejays held off the Bulldogs with free throws down the stretch. Drake's first three field goals were 3-pointers, giving the Bulldogs an 11-5 lead. But Creighton responded with a barrage of its own, hitting five shots from beyond the arc in a 17-0 run to lead by 11 midway through the half. Mathies made three straight 3-pointers to put the Bluejays up 37-20 before the Bulldogs scored seven straight to get within 10. Mathies stopped the rally, scoring five straight points, including his sixth 3-pointer, and the Bluejays led 48-31 at halftime. Creighton was 11-for-15 on 3s in the first half, then went just 1-for-7 the rest of the game. The crowd of 14,796 was the fourth largest in Creighton history.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
